Event: Highland [Maya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maya_civilization ) fall to the lowland city of [Teotihuacan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teotihuacan )
Significance: Begins the decline of [Maya culture](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maya_culture ) and [language](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mayan_languages ) in some parts of the highlands.
The Christian Gospel is translated into [Latin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latin ).

Event: Rome is [sacked](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sack_of_Rome_(410) ) by [Alaric](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alaric_I ), King of the [Visigoths](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Visigoths )
Significance: Decisive event in the decline of the [Western Roman Empire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_Roman_Empire ).

Confirmed the original [Nicene Creed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicene_Creed ), and condemned the teachings of [Nestorius](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nestorius ), [Patriarch of Constantinople](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecumenical_Patriarch_of_Constantinople ), that led to his exile and separation with the [Church of the East](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Church_of_the_East ).

Event: Rome is [sacked](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sack_of_Rome_(455) ) by [Genseric](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genseric ), King of the [Vandals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vandals ).
Significance: Another decisive event in the [Fall of Rome](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fall_of_Rome ) and held by some historians to mark the 'end of the Roman Empire'.
Considered by some historians to be the starting point of the [Middle Ages](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Middle_Ages ).

Event: Death of [Julius Nepos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julius_Nepos ), last [Roman Emperor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roman_Emperor ) to be recognized as such by the Roman Senate and the [Byzantine Empire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byzantine_Empire )
Significance: Considered by some historians to be the starting point of the [Middle Ages](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Middle_Ages ).

Event: [Theodoric the Great](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theodoric_the_Great ) killed [Odoacer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Odoacer ) at a banquet after the [Siege of Ravenna (490–493)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Ravenna_(490%E2%80%93493) ).
